intro: Matricaria corymbifera, commonly known as the common chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, which bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has a compact, bushy appearance. Its leaves are finely divided and covered in a soft, hairy layer, while its stems are upright and often branched. This species is often cultivated for its aromatic properties and is used in herbal teas and traditional medicine.
